title: WE're buffing Lee Sin so he's in even more of your games.
body:
"For professionals, Lee Sin is a perfect champion; a strong contributor at each stage of the game, flexible in item builds and adaptable to almost any scenario. For the average player however, he’s that champion you wish you didn’t see on your team due to the sheer number of games required to reach a certain level of competency."

Taken from the patch notes. I like patch notes guy, I really do, some of his jokes are all right. But this is flat out hyperbole. 

People don't hate lee sin because he's tough to use (ward jumping is hard hurr hurr) 

People hate lee sin because he's a ball of utility that is as you say strong at all stages of the game  And the community at large is already rolling their collective eyes at the thought of this waving,hopping,kicking ball of cancer being in every game they ever play for this patch. 

Even more, Rito made the running joke on the forums reality. 

Lee buffs right before world$$$$. Zed buffs right before World$$$$ Leblanc buffs right before World$$$$ Who'd have thought huh?

#LCSpatchweallsawcoming.

Allow me to take on a role of a Rioter and provide some context here.

We've noticed Lee's peel isn't as godlike as the rest of his kit, so we are giving it a huge buff. Also, we are punishing enemy team for their tank making the right decisions by building HP and being in the frontline. This is something we have actively been trying to avoid, even completely scrapping Karma because of it, but hey, Mr. Lee "LC$BIGPLAYS" Sin has already proven multiple times that he is immune to our balance guidelines.

Oh, and we've noticed that Lee might sometimes run out of energy if he spams his spells like a madman. Then he has to use 2 AAs to restore it, and this actually gives a window of opportunity for his opponent to retaliate. We don't want enemy having a fair chance against our poster boy, so we are increasing energy return on the first AA.

We'll be watching these changes closely. They are intended to bring Lee back to being picked in 80%+ of the games, because, let's be honest - who doesn't love seeing LC$BIGPLAYS even at a cost of having to face an absolutely toxic champion? If he still falls short, we are considering some more minor buffs like removing his energy costs and making all of his abilities count as AAs for the purpose of on-hit effects to make him able to properly ~~overshadow~~ compete with Devourer junglers.
